entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Supreme Court pauses police action against Sadhguru's Isha FoundationThe Supreme Court paused a Madras High Court order that permitted police action against spiritual guru Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev's Isha Foundation in Coimbatore.

Didn't meant to hurt you, Samantha: Telangana minister retracts divorce remarkTelangana minister Konda Surekha retracted her remarks accusing BRS's KT Rama Rao for being responsible for actors Samantha and Naga Chaitanya's divorce.

Iran, firing missiles at Israel now, worked with it on a missile projectIran fired around 200 missiles into Israel on October 1. It is interesting to note that Iran and Israel, now sworn enemies, had collaborated in the 1970s on 'Project Flower', which was aimed at developing surface-to-surface missiles. What more, the missiles were intended to be fitted with nuclear warheads.

Solid perfume is a hit, but is it a skin hazard?Want to give in to the buzz and add a solid perfume to your collection? Before you click 'add to cart,' find out what experts think about this trendy product.

'Kingpin' of Rs 5,000 crore drug bust in Delhi has Congress connectionThe alleged mastermind of the operation, Tushar Goyal was the chairman of the RTI cell of the Delhi Pradesh Congress, police sources said.

Kolkata rape-murder victim's statue unveiled at RG Kar hospital, sparks rowJunior doctors installed a statue of the trainee doctor who was raped and murdered at Kolkata's RG Kar hospital on August 9, in a move that has drawn massive backlash.

Karnataka's food safety warning: Can cake from your local bakery cause cancer?Bengaluru cake shops have been urged by Karnataka's food safety authority to closely monitor the use of food colourants in their baked goods. Over 12 cake samples were found to contain cancer-causing chemicals.

She faced significant backlash for her unsubstantiated claims.

Two teens enter Delhi hospital under pretext of injury, shoot doctorA doctor was killed by two unknown teenagers inside a hospital in Delhi's Jaitpur area. After the incident, the police launched a probe into the incident to arrest the accused.

IndiGo clarifies after viral video shows pilot refusing to fly Pune-Bengaluru flightThe incident sparked a discussion on social media after an X user shared a video recently showing frustrated passengers confronting both the pilot and the IndiGo crew about the delay.

Everyone born equal: Top court scraps caste-based discrimination rules in jailsA bench led by Chief Justice DY Chandrachud struck down provisions in state prison manuals enabling caste-based discrimination against inmates and ordered all states to amend the discriminatory rules within three months.

Nasrallah agreed to ceasefire before he was killed by Israel: Lebanon ministerHassan Nasrallah, the Hezbollah chief who died in an Israeli airstrike last month, had agreed to a 21-day ceasefire with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu shortly before his death, according to Lebanon Foreign Minister Abdallah Bou Habib.

RJD leader chased for 1 km, shot at multiple times by bike-borne men in BiharPankaj Yadav was shot by two bike-borne men when he was on his routinely morning walk near the airport on Thursday morning.

Israel 'plans' to hit Iran's nukes, Biden says response should be proportionateUS President Joe Biden was opposed to the idea of Israel striking Iran's nuclear and oil facilities amid Middle East tensions and urged the Jewish nation to act "proportionately".

Millie Bobby Brown's wedding had a Stranger Things connectionActor Millie Bobby Brown recently shared dreamy photos from her wedding with longtime boyfriend Jake Bongiovi. The couple, who married in May of this year, had an interesting connection to Brown's popular series, Stranger Things.

Jr NTR, Allu Arjun and celebs call out Telangana minister's remarks on Telugu industryTelugu actors Jr NTR, Allu Arjun, Megastar Chiranjeevi, Nani and several others lashed out at Telangana minister Konda Surekha for passing controversial remarks regarding actors in the Telugu film industry. WHO recommends vaccine shots for pregnant women and infants against RSVThe WHO has recommended a single shot of RSV vaccine for pregnant women, in the third trimester that typically starts at 28 weeks, to protect their babies.

sports.headline: RCB should convince Rohit Sharma and make him captain: Mohammad KaifIPL 2025: Royal Challengers Bengaluru should try and convince Rohit Sharma and make him their captain if he is not retained by Mumbai Indians, former cricketer Mohammad Kaif said. Rohit played under Hardik Pandya in IPL 2024.

Real Madrid boss Ancelotti has no excuses after Lille loss: Everything was badReal Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti feels that his team deserves to be criticised after their shock loss to Lille in the Champions League on October 2, Wednesday. The French side ended Los Blancos' unbeaten run.

Who is Jafer Chohan: From dismissing Joe Root in nets to England call-upJafer Chohan is the latest spinner to make his debut in the England team as he continued his impressive run of form. Chohan was used as a net bowler by England during the Pakistan tour in 2022.

Shamar Joseph among 9 players to get historic multi-year West Indies contractCricket West Indies announced multi-year contracts for as many as nine players, including three from the senior women's team. Multi-year contracts have been handed to players for the first time in a bid to avoid more talent drain to franchise-based T20 leagues.

Messi scores insane free-kick as Inter Miami win Supporters' Shield in MLSLionel Messi scored a ridiculous free-kick to help Inter Miami win the Supporters' Shield in Major League Soccer on Wednesday, October 2. Messi scored a brace in the team's 3-2 win over Columbus Crew.

He is part of Mumbai's Ranji Trophy-winning squad who are playing Rest of India in Irani Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
